msItem.title: Gädlä Kiros “Vita of Kiros”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist of Text I; 1st, 2nd, 5th and 6th line on the incipit page of Texts I and II; a small cross on fol. 99r; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 1ra-2ra: በስመ፡”… ገድል፡ ዘብፁዕ፡ ወቅዱስ፡ አባ፡ ኪሮስ፨ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስሌነ፡ አሜን፨ ወሀሎ፡ ፩ንጉሥ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ጻድቅ፡ ወፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወወለደ፡ ወልደ፡ ወሰመየ፡ ስሞ፡ ዮናኒ፨ ወእምዝ፡ አዕረፈ፡ ወእምድኅሬሁ፡ ነበረ፡ ዮናኒ፡ ዲበ፡ በመንበረ፡ አቡሁ፨ ወገብረ፡ ኵሎ፡ ሠናያተ፡ ዘያሠምሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ከመ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወወለደ፡ ወልደ፡ ወሰመየ፡ ስሞ አብያ፨ ወእምድኅረ፡ ፷ዓመተ፡ አዕረፈ፡ በክብር፡ ወነበረ፡ አብያ፡ ወልዱ፡ ዲበ፡ መንበረ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወገብረ፡ ጽድቀ ከመ፡ አቡሁ፨ ወኢያሕፀፀ፡ ወኢምንተኒ፡ ወስማ፡ ለብእሲቱ፡ ኒናሲር፨ ወነበረ፡ መካን፡ ፴ዐመተ፨ ወእምዝ፡ ጸለዩ፡ ኅቡረ፡ ኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብያ ወብእሲቱ፡ ኒናሲር፡ እስከ፡ ሰምዖሙ፡ ጸሎቶሙ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወፀንሰት፡ በጊዜሁ፡ ወወለደት፡ መንታ… Fol. 1ra-2ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. The vita of the blessed holy father Kiros. Let his prayer and blessing be with us, Amen. And there was one king in the city of Rome, righteous and who feared God, and he begat a son and gave him a name Yonani. And then he died and afterwards Yonani was on the throne of his father. And did everything good in what God was pleased like his father and he begat a son whose name was ʾAbya. And after 60 years he died in glory and ʾAbya, his son, was on the throne of his father and he did righteous deeds like his father and did not reduce [them] not even once and the name of his wife (was) Ninasir. And he [sic] was infertile for 30 years. And thereafter they prayed to God, ʾAbya and his wife, and she conceived in its time and she gave birth to twins.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 73rab: ወተመጠዉ᎓ ምሥጢራተ᎓ ቅዱሳት᎓ አባ᎓ ባውሚን᎓ ወአባ᎓ ስሞዖን᎓ ወአባ፡ በብኑዳ᎓ ወአባ᎓ አሞይ፨ ወአባ᎓ ኤላርዮን᎓ ወአባ᎓ አቡናፍር፨ ወአባ᎓ ለተፁን᎓ ወአባ᎓ ፋውሊ፨ ምስለ᎓ ነቢያት᎓ ወሐዋርያት፨ ወምስለ፡ መላእክት᎓ ንጹሐን᎓ ወበእደዊሁ᎓ ለመድኀኒነ፨ ጸሎቶሙ፡ ወበረከቶሙ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ…Fol. 73rab: And they received the sacraments, father Bawmin and father Sǝmʿon and father Bäbnuda and father Amoy. And father Elarion and father Abunafǝr. And father Lätäṣun and father Fauli. With prophets and apostles. And with angels [and] the pure and what is in hands of the Saviour, let their prayer be with…

note.p: Marrassini (2004:79-81) refers to this version of the Vita of Kiros as the text of “type 1”, most commonly spread and contained in many Mss. It is different from the Vita of “type 2” which is attested in a few Mss. only (translated and published: B. Turaev, “Kopto-efiopskoe skazanie o prepodobnom Kire”, Zapiski vostočnago otdelenija I.R.Arheologičeskago Obščestva 15, 1903, 1–14). Marrassini (2004:83) distinguishes two kinds of type 1 Vita of Kiros: “long” and “short”. Ms. MAKM-053contains the “short” version.

msItem.title: Gädlä Nob “Vita of Nob”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist of Text I; 1st, 2nd, 5th and 6th line on the incipit page of Texts I and II; a small cross on fol. 99r; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fols. 74rab: በስመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሕያው፡ ሥሉስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፈጣሪ፡ ወነባቢ፨ ገድል፡ ወስምዕ፡ ዘአባ፡ ኖብ፡ ሰማዕተ፡ እግዝእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፨ ዘነበረ፡ በሀገረ፡ ኒኂሳ፨ ወፈጸመ፡ ገድሎ፡ ወሠናይቶ፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፬፡ ለወርኃ፡ ሐምሌ፡ በሰላመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ አሜን፤ ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ አሕጐለ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ልበ፡ ድዮግልድያኖስ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዕልው፡ ወኀደጎ፡ ለአምላከ፡ ሰማይ፨ ወለመላእክቲሁ፡ ቅዱሳን፨Fols. 74rab: In the name of the living God, Threefold Holy, Creator and Speaker. The vita and martyrdom of ʾabba Nob, martyr of our Lord Jesus Christ, who lived in the city Niḫisa and gave his good testimony on 24th of the month Ḥamle in the peace of God the Father, Amen. And it happened that Satan seduced the heart of Diocletian, an evil king, and he abandoned the God of Heaven and his saint angels.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 150va-151rb: አነ፡ ውእቱ፡ ዮልዮስ፡ ስማዕት፡ ላዕለ፡ ዘኮነ፡ እምኔሁ። ወፈጸመ፡ ስምዖ፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፬፡ ለወርኃ፡ ሐምሌ፨ ወሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ መልዕልት፡ ኀበ፡ ዘአፍቀሮ፡ መሐሪ፡ ክርስቶስ፨ ወኮነ፡ ፈውሰ፡ ለኵሎሙ፡ ኃጥአን፡ በጸጋ፡ ወሳህል፡ ወበፍቅረ፡ ሰብእ፨ ዘበእንቲአሁ፡ ይደሉ፡ ስብሐት፨ ለአቡሁ፡ ኄር፡ መሐሪ፨ ወለመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ማኅየዊ፨ ዘዕሩይ፡ ምስሌሁ፡ በመለኮቱ፨ እምይእዜ፡ ወእስከ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ወአሜን፨ ለይኩን ለይኩን፨Fol. 150va-151rb: I am Yolios the witness of what happened here. And he gave testimony on 24th of the month Ḥamle. And he went to the Highest to his beloved merciful Christ. And all sinners became redeemed by grace and compassion and love of humankind. For the sake of that He deserves glory, for His Father, good [and] merciful, and for the Holy Ghost life-giver who is equal with Him in His divinity. From now and forever, Amen, and Amen. So be it, so be it.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 155.0 folios, of which blank 155v, in 20.0 quires (19+B).
17.5 18.5 8.0

list.item: 8 XII(8; s.l.: 7, stub after 6; 2, stub after 1/fols. 90r-97v)
8 XIV(8; s.l.: 6, stub after 5; 3, stub after 3/fols. 106r-113v)

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. has been resewn (traces of the original sewing stations are seen on the spine fold of the quires). The board attachment has been crudely repaired. The spine cover is missing. A few fols. (1, 2, 153, 154) are destroyed in the middle and upper parts, most probably eaten by insects. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 23, 50, 52, 79, 87, 119, 120, 123.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: Colon with red dashes above and below (fols. 57vb, 59vb);
Colon with black dashes above and below (fol. 61rb);

Colon with red dashes above and below and red dots on both sides (e.g., fols. 2va,3rb, 3vb, 4ra, 4vb, 5vb, 6ra, 6va, 8rb, 9rab, 9va, 10rb, 12rb, 17rab, 38rab, 43ra, 68rab, 76rb, 83rb, 98rab, 102rab, 106rab, 115rab)
II. Nine dot asterisk (used throughout the Ms.);
III. Doubled nine dot asterisk with dashes in between (fols. 73vb, 149rb, 151ra, 152rb);
Two four dot asterisks with dashes above, below and in between, in red (fol. 151va);
A chain of red dots connected with each other by means of black dashes (fol. 152rb);
Two parallel chains of black dashes (fol. 153ra);

handDesc.handNote: Fine and careful, in a well-trained hand. Black, red (strong amaranth, vivid red)The name of the scribe has been erased from fol. 153vb.16th century
- Numeral ፲ has a peculiar rare form with a ring: fols. 20va, 33ra, 56va, 78va, 151rb.
- in the letter ጵ the 6th order marker is attached to the left side of the vertical stroke: fols. 66va, 107vb, 112va.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 1r (incipit page of Text I): elaborate coloured (dark grayish chartreuse green, strong scarlet and strong amber) ornamental band; floral motifs.
Fol. 74r (incipit page of Text II): elaborate coloured (dark grayish chartreuse green, strong scarlet and strong amber) ornamental band; floral motifs.

list.item: Fol. 152ra: Supplication prayer to a saint (?).Fol. 152ra: ኦአቡየ፡ ˂…˃ ኪረከ፡ ኵሎ፡ ድካምየ፡ ሀበኒ፡ አስብየ፡ እስመ፡ አንተ፡ ተአምር፡ ከመ፡ ይብል፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ይደልዎ፡ አስቦ፡ ለዘ፡ ተቀንየ። እግዚአብሔር፡ የሀብከ፡ ዕሴተ፡ ሠናየ፡ አሜን። ወአሜን።

- Omitted letters, words and passages written interlineally in small script, in the main hand: fols. 6ra, 6va, 11vb, 15vb, 34rb, 54va, 139ra. - Omitted word written interlineally in small script, in a secondary hand: 46ra. - Corrections written over erasures, in the main hand: fols. 8vb, 104ra. - A small cross: fol. 99r. - Scribbles: fols. 2v, 4r.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Small holes is visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

listBibl.bibl: Ms. previously unknown.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The name of the commissioner has been erased from the supplication formulas on fols. 56vb, 151va and from the concluding supplications on fols. 73va, 152va; the name of ʾabunä Krǝstos ʾAbuhu is mentioned in the supplication formula on fol. 73ra and can still be assumed on fol. 151va. The erased name has been replace with the name of Täklä Haymanot (s. fols. 73vab, 152va).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
